cli progress bar benchmark

Gábor Csárdi

2021-06-23

Source: vignettes/progress-benchmark.Rmd
progress-benchmark.Rmd

Introduction

We make sure that the timer is not TRUE, by setting it to ten hours.

library(cli)
# 10 hours
cli:::cli_tick_set(10 * 60 * 60 * 1000)
cli_tick_reset()
#> NULL
`__cli_update_due`
#> [1] FALSE

R benchmarks

The timer

fun <- function() NULL
ben_st <- bench::mark(
  `__cli_update_due`,
  fun(),
  .Call(ccli_tick_reset),
  interactive(),
  check = FALSE
)
ben_st
#> # A tibble: 4 x 6
#>   expression                  min   median `itr/sec` mem_alloc `gc/sec`
#>   <bch:expr>             <bch:tm> <bch:tm>     <dbl> <bch:byt>    <dbl>
#> 1 __cli_update_due           56ns     77ns 12026892.        0B        0
#> 2 fun()                     558ns    674ns  1266465.        0B        0
#> 3 .Call(ccli_tick_reset)    450ns    561ns  1765675.        0B        0
#> 4 interactive()             132ns    160ns  6071351.        0B        0
ben_st2 <- bench::mark(
  if (`__cli_update_due`) foobar()
)
ben_st2
#> # A tibble: 1 x 6
#>   expression                            min  median `itr/sec` mem_alloc `gc/sec`
#>   <bch:expr>                       <bch:tm> <bch:t>     <dbl> <bch:byt>    <dbl>
#> 1 if (`__cli_update_due`) foobar()    207ns   233ns  4179536.        0B        0

cli_progress_along() 

seq <- 1:100000
ta <- cli_progress_along(seq)
bench::mark(seq[[1]], ta[[1]])
#> # A tibble: 2 x 6
#>   expression      min   median `itr/sec` mem_alloc `gc/sec`
#>   <bch:expr> <bch:tm> <bch:tm>     <dbl> <bch:byt>    <dbl>
#> 1 seq[[1]]      459ns    531ns  1783333.        0B     178.
#> 2 ta[[1]]       507ns    586ns  1668786.        0B       0

for loop

This is the baseline:

f0 <- function(n = 1e5) {
  x <- 0
  seq <- 1:n
  for (i in seq) {
    x <- x + i %% 2
  }
  x
}

With progress bars:

fp <- function(n = 1e5) {
  x <- 0
  seq <- 1:n
  for (i in cli_progress_along(seq)) {
    x <- x + seq[[i]] %% 2
  }
  x
}

Overhead per iteration:

ben_taf <- bench::mark(f0(), fp())
ben_taf
#> # A tibble: 2 x 6
#>   expression      min   median `itr/sec` mem_alloc `gc/sec`
#>   <bch:expr> <bch:tm> <bch:tm>     <dbl> <bch:byt>    <dbl>
#> 1 f0()         16.2ms   16.2ms      61.6    96.8KB    1540.
#> 2 fp()         19.1ms   19.1ms      52.3   138.2KB    1098.
(ben_taf$median[2] - ben_taf$median[1]) / 1e5
#> [1] 29ns

Mapping with lapply

This is the baseline:

f0 <- function(n = 1e5) {
  seq <- 1:n
  ret <- lapply(seq, function(x) {
    x %% 2
  })
  invisible(ret)
}

With an index vector:

f01 <- function(n = 1e5) {
  seq <- 1:n
  ret <- lapply(seq_along(seq), function(i) {
    seq[[i]] %% 2
  })
  invisible(ret)
}

With progress bars:

fp <- function(n = 1e5) {
  seq <- 1:n
  ret <- lapply(cli_progress_along(seq), function(i) {
    seq[[i]] %% 2
  })
  invisible(ret)
}

Overhead per iteration:

ben_tam <- bench::mark(f0(), f01(), fp())
#> Warning: Some expressions had a GC in every iteration; so filtering is disabled.
ben_tam
#> # A tibble: 3 x 6
#>   expression      min   median `itr/sec` mem_alloc `gc/sec`
#>   <bch:expr> <bch:tm> <bch:tm>     <dbl> <bch:byt>    <dbl>
#> 1 f0()          102ms    114ms      8.21     781KB     16.4
#> 2 f01()         147ms    167ms      6.10     781KB     13.7
#> 3 fp()          178ms    188ms      5.13     785KB     13.7
(ben_tam$median[3] - ben_tam$median[1]) / 1e5
#> [1] 749ns
ben_tam2 <- bench::mark(f0(1e6), f01(1e6), fp(1e6))
#> Warning: Some expressions had a GC in every iteration; so filtering is disabled.
ben_tam2
#> # A tibble: 3 x 6
#>   expression      min   median `itr/sec` mem_alloc `gc/sec`

#> 1 f0(1e+06)     1.27s    1.27s     0.790    7.63MB     6.32
#> 2 f01(1e+06)       3s       3s     0.334    7.63MB     3.00
#> 3 fp(1e+06)     1.55s    1.55s     0.645    7.63MB     1.94
(ben_tam2$median[3] - ben_tam2$median[1]) / 1e6
#> [1] 284ns
(ben_tam2$median[3] - ben_tam2$median[2]) / 1e6
#> [1] 1ns

Mapping with purrr

This is the baseline:

f0 <- function(n = 1e5) {
  seq <- 1:n
  ret <- purrr::map(seq, function(x) {
    x %% 2
  })
  invisible(ret)
}

With index vector:

f01 <- function(n = 1e5) {
  seq <- 1:n
  ret <- purrr::map(seq_along(seq), function(i) {
    seq[[i]] %% 2
  })
  invisible(ret)
}

With progress bars:

fp <- function(n = 1e5) {
  seq <- 1:n
  ret <- purrr::map(cli_progress_along(seq), function(i) {
    seq[[i]] %% 2
  })
  invisible(ret)
}

Overhead per iteration:

#> [1] 118ns

ticking() 

f0 <- function(n = 1e5) {
  i <- 0
  x <- 0 
  while (i < n) {
    x <- x + i %% 2
    i <- i + 1
  }
  x
}
fp <- function(n = 1e5) {
  i <- 0
  x <- 0 
  while (ticking(i < n)) {
    x <- x + i %% 2
    i <- i + 1
  }
  x
}
ben_tk <- bench::mark(f0(), fp())
#> Warning: Some expressions had a GC in every iteration; so filtering is disabled.
ben_tk
#> # A tibble: 2 x 6
#>   expression      min   median `itr/sec` mem_alloc `gc/sec`
#>   <bch:expr> <bch:tm> <bch:tm>     <dbl> <bch:byt>    <dbl>
#> 1 f0()        16.82ms  17.45ms    48.9      41.3KB    3.92 
#> 2 fp()          7.72s    7.72s     0.130    98.7KB    0.907
(ben_tk$median[2] - ben_tk$median[1]) / 1e5
#> [1] 77µs

Traditional API

f0 <- function(n = 1e5) {
  x <- 0
  for (i in 1:n) {
    x <- x + i %% 2
  }
  x
}
fp <- function(n = 1e5) {
  cli_progress_bar(total = n)
  x <- 0
  for (i in 1:n) {
    x <- x + i %% 2
    cli_progress_update()
  }
  x
}
ff <- function(n = 1e5) {
  cli_progress_bar(total = n)
  x <- 0
  for (i in 1:n) {
    x <- x + i %% 2
    if (`__cli_update_due`) cli_progress_update()
  }
  x
}
ben_api <- bench::mark(f0(), ff(), fp())
#> Warning: Some expressions had a GC in every iteration; so filtering is disabled.
ben_api
#> # A tibble: 3 x 6
#>   expression      min   median `itr/sec` mem_alloc `gc/sec`
#>   <bch:expr> <bch:tm> <bch:tm>     <dbl> <bch:byt>    <dbl>
#> 1 f0()        15.28ms   15.7ms    54.7      19.9KB    3.91 
#> 2 ff()        23.05ms  23.46ms    39.3      30.4KB    1.97 
#> 3 fp()          4.26s    4.26s     0.235    25.3KB    0.938
(ben_api$median[3] - ben_api$median[1]) / 1e5
#> [1] 42.5µs
(ben_api$median[2] - ben_api$median[1]) / 1e5
#> [1] 77.6ns
ben_api2 <- bench::mark(f0(1e6), ff(1e6), fp(1e6))
#> Warning: Some expressions had a GC in every iteration; so filtering is disabled.
ben_api2
#> # A tibble: 3 x 6
#>   expression      min   median `itr/sec` mem_alloc `gc/sec`
#>   <bch:expr> <bch:tm> <bch:tm>     <dbl> <bch:byt>    <dbl>
#> 1 f0(1e+06)   175.4ms  176.8ms    5.44          0B    3.63 
#> 2 ff(1e+06)   240.4ms    251ms    3.98      3.66KB    3.98 
#> 3 fp(1e+06)     44.2s    44.2s    0.0226    1.16KB    0.951
(ben_api2$median[3] - ben_api2$median[1]) / 1e6
#> [1] 44µs
(ben_api2$median[2] - ben_api2$median[1]) / 1e6
#> [1] 74.2ns

C benchmarks

Baseline function:

SEXP test_baseline() {
  int i;
  int res = 0;
  for (i = 0; i < 2000000000; i++) {
    res += i % 2;
  }
  return ScalarInteger(res);
}

Switch + modulo check:

SEXP test_modulo(SEXP progress) {
  int i;
  int res = 0;
  int progress_ = LOGICAL(progress)[0];
  for (i = 0; i < 2000000000; i++) {
    if (i % 10000 == 0 && progress_) cli_progress_set(R_NilValue, i);
    res += i % 2;
  }
  return ScalarInteger(res);
}

cli progress bar API:

SEXP test_cli() {
  int i;
  int res = 0;
  SEXP bar = PROTECT(cli_progress_bar(2000000000, NULL));
  for (i = 0; i < 2000000000; i++) {
    if (CLI_SHOULD_TICK) cli_progress_set(bar, i);
    res += i % 2;
  }
  cli_progress_done(bar);
  UNPROTECT(1);
  return ScalarInteger(res);
}
SEXP test_cli_unroll() {
  int i = 0;
  int res = 0;
  SEXP bar = PROTECT(cli_progress_bar(2000000000, NULL));
  int s, final, step = 2000000000 / 100000;
  for (s = 0; s < 100000; s++) {
    if (CLI_SHOULD_TICK) cli_progress_set(bar, i);
    final = (s + 1) * step;
    for (i = s * step; i < final; i++) {
      res += i % 2;
    }
  }
  cli_progress_done(bar);
  UNPROTECT(1);
  return ScalarInteger(res);
}
library(progresstest)
ben_c <- bench::mark(
  test_baseline(),
  test_modulo(),
  test_cli(),
  test_cli_unroll()
)
ben_c
#> # A tibble: 4 x 6
#>   expression             min   median `itr/sec` mem_alloc `gc/sec`
#>   <bch:expr>        <bch:tm> <bch:tm>     <dbl> <bch:byt>    <dbl>
#> 1 test_baseline()   106.72ms 108.19ms     9.13     2.08KB        0
#> 2 test_modulo()        1.13s    1.13s     0.887    2.24KB        0
#> 3 test_cli()           1.37s    1.37s     0.730   22.22KB        0
#> 4 test_cli_unroll() 107.71ms  109.2ms     9.20      3.4KB        0
(ben_c$median[3] - ben_c$median[1]) / 2000000000
#> [1] 1ns

Display update

We only update the display a fixed number of times per second. (Currently maximum five times per second.)

Let’s measure how long a single update takes.

Iterator with a bar

cli_progress_bar(total = 100000)
bench::mark(cli_progress_update(force = TRUE), max_iterations = 10000)
#> ■                                  0% | ETA:  7m
#> ■                                  0% | ETA:  4h
#> ■                                  0% | ETA:  3h
